text: I am Shubhankar Gambhir, a CSE sophomore at IIT Kanpur. I have interest and prior knowledge of numerical methods, PDEs and Linear Algebra and I want to work with Julia Organisation in GSoC 2021, can anyone guide me how to proceed further and what issue I can work on.

text: Hey! I would find a project and then ping a specific mentor for said project

text:
Hi Logan. Is it too late to start trying for JSoC? A lot of people start contributing way back in December but I haven't contributed anything till now because I was busy with my job/research. I have good experience using Julia (in my research) though I feel like it is too late for anything any more. <@UGR3910CQ>
I've read all of the posts in the prior years which state that there are too many high quality applicants having loads of prior contribution to the Julia ecosystem.. Even though I love Julia so much, I don't know if I can make it to JSoC this year since I would be outweighed by them.

elements.text: Hi Logan. Is it too late to start trying for JSoC? A lot of people start contributing way back in December but I haven't contributed anything till now because I was busy with my job/research. I have good experience using Julia (in my research) though I feel like it is too late for anything any more.

I've read all of the posts in the prior years which state that there are too many high quality applicants having loads of prior contribution to the Julia ecosystem.. Even though I love Julia so much, I don't know if I can make it to JSoC this year since I would be outweighed by them.

text: Hey! I would find a project that interests you and start contributing. While it is indeed competitive, it’s definitely not too late
